title: Energy Levels of a Hydrogen Atom
subtitle: Explore the orbital shapes of hydrogen's electron.
credits: This interactive was created by the [Concord Consortium](https://concord.org/) using our [Next-Generation Molecular Workbench](http://mw.concord.org/nextgen/) software, with funding by a grant from [Google.org](https://www.google.org/).
This interactive also uses [JSMol](https://sourceforge.net/projects/jsmol/), licensed under the [LGPL](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/lgpl.html) license.
about: The likely location of an electron around the nucleus of an atom
is called an orbital. The shape of an orbital depends on the energy
A neutral hydrogen atom has one electron. Click in the boxes to set the
energy of that electron and see the orbital shape describing where you are
likely to find that electron around the nucleus.

onLoad: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 1s orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 1 0 0;');

parameters.name: clear-all
onChange: /* It's a workaround, as we can't create globally available function that could do the same thing.
Change value of this parameter to 'true' to clear other parameters. */
/* Freeze currently selected level so user can't 'uncheck' it directly. */

parameters.name: 4s
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 4s orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 4 0 0;');

parameters.name: 4p
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 4p orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 4 1 0;');

parameters.name: 4d
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 4d orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 4 2 0;');

parameters.name: 4f
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 4f orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 4 3 0;');

parameters.name: 3s
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 3s orbital;isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 3 0 0;');

parameters.name: 3p
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 3p orbital;isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 3 1 0;');

parameters.name: 3d
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 3d orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 3 2 0;');

parameters.name: 2s
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 2s orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 2 0 0;');

parameters.name: 2p
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 2p orbital;isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 2 1 0;');

parameters.name: 1s
onChange: post('jsmolScript', 'echo 1s orbital; isosurface delete sign orange violet phase atomicOrbital 1 0 0;');

components.text: ####Click on a gray box to move the electron to that energy level / orbital.####
